horiba ihr320 API

Horiba iHR320 monochromator module.

This python module allows the control of Horiba iHR320 monochromator via USB raw data protocol.

exception horiba_ihr320.horiba_ihr320.NoMonoFound

Bases: Exception

class horiba_ihr320.horiba_ihr320.iHR320

Bases: object

property SLIT_ENTRANCE

Constant parameter corresponding to the “Entrance” port of the slits.

Should be preferred as parameter to select the “Entrance” port.

See also: get_slit_width() or set_slit_width()

Type

int

property SLIT_EXIT

Constant parameter corresponding to the “Exit” port of the slits.

Should be preferred as parameter to select the “Exit” port.

See also: get_slit_width() or set_slit_width()

Type

int

property SLIT_FRONT

Constant parameter corresponding to the “Front” position of the slits.

Should be preferred as parameter to select the “Front” position.

See also: get_slit_width() or set_slit_width()

Type

int

property SLIT_SIDE

Constant parameter corresponding to the “Side” position of the slits.

Should be preferred as parameter to select the “Side” position.

See also: get_slit_width() or set_slit_width()

Type

int

property MIRROR_ENTRANCE

Constant parameter corresponding to the “Entrance” mirror.

Should be preferred as parameter to select the “Entrance” port.

See also: get_mirror_position() or set_mirror_position()

Type

int

property MIRROR_EXIT

Constant parameter corresponding to the “Exit” mirror.

Should be preferred as parameter to select the “Exit” port.

See also: get_mirror_position() or set_mirror_position()

Type

int

property MIRROR_FRONT

Constant parameter corresponding to the “Front” position for the mirror.

Should be preferred as parameter to select the “Front” position.

See also: get_mirror_position() or set_mirror_position()

Type

int

property MIRROR_SIDE

Constant parameter corresponding to the “Side” position for the mirror.

Should be preferred as parameter to select the “Side” position.

See also: get_mirror_position() or set_mirror_position()

Type

int

force_initialize() → None

Force the initialization of the Horiba iHR320 monochromateur.

Examples: To force the initialization.

>>> import iHR320
>>> my_iHR320 = iHR320()
>>> my_iHR320.force_initialize()
get_wavelength() → float

Get the actual wavelength in nanometer.

Returns

Wavelength in nanometer.

Examples

To get the wavelength.

>>> import iHR320
>>> my_iHR320 = iHR320()
>>> wavelength = my_iHR320.get_wavelength()
set_wavelength(wavelength: float) → None

Set the wavelength in nanometer.

Parameters

wavelength – wavelength in nanometer.

Examples

To set the wavelength to 628.5 nm.

>>> import iHR320
>>> my_iHR320 = iHR320()
>>> my_iHR320.set_wavelength(628.5)
get_slit_width(port: int, position: int) → float

Get the width in millimeter of the selected slit.

Parameters

  • port – Slit port (“Entrance” or “Exit”). Use iHR320.SLIT_ENTRANCE or iHR320.SLIT_EXIT property.

  • position – Slit Position (“Front” or “Side”). Use iHR320.SLIT_FRONT or iHR320.SLIT_SIDE property.

Returns

Width in millimeter of the selected slit.

Examples

To get the “Front” “Entrance” slit width.

>>> import iHR320
>>> my_iHR320 = iHR320()
>>> width = my_iHR320.get_slit_width(my_iHR320.SLIT_ENTRANCE, my_iHR320.SLIT_FRONT)
set_slit_width(port: int, position: int, width: float) → None

Set the width in millimeter of the selected slit.

Parameters

  • port –

    Slit port (“Entrance” or “Exit”).

    Use iHR320.SLIT_ENTRANCE or iHR320.SLIT_EXIT property.

  • position –

    Slit position (“Front” or “Side”).

    Use iHR320.SLIT_FRONT or iHR320.SLIT_SIDE property.

  • width – Width of the selected slit in millimeter.

Examples: To set the “Front” “Entrance” slit to 1.5 mm.

>>> import iHR320
>>> my_iHR320 = iHR320()
>>> my_iHR320.set_slit_width(my_iHR320.SLIT_ENTRANCE, my_iHR320.SLIT_FRONT, 1.5)
get_mirror_position(port) → int

Get the position of the selected mirror.

Parameters

port (int) –

Which port of the mirror (“Entrance” or “Exit”).

Use iHR320.MIRROR_ENTRANCE or iHR320.MIRROR_EXIT property.

Returns

The orientation of the selected mirror.

iHR320.MIRROR_FRONT or iHR320.MIRROR_SIDE orientation.

Examples: To get the “Entrance” mirror position.

>>> import iHR320
>>> my_iHR320 = iHR320()
>>> mirror_position = my_iHR320.get_mirror_position(my_iHR320.MIRROR_ENTRANCE)
set_mirror_position(port: int, position: int) → None

Set the mirror position.

This function set the orientation of the selected mirror.

Parameters

  • port (int) –

    Which port of the mirror (“Entrance” or “Exit”).

    Use iHR320.MIRROR_ENTRANCE or iHR320.MIRROR_EXIT property.

  • position (int) – The orientation of the selected mirror iHR320.MIRROR_FRONT for the “Front” orientation or iHR320.MIRROR_SIDE for the “Side” orientation.

Examples: To set the “Exit” mirror to “Side” position.

>>> import iHR320
>>> my_iHR320 = iHR320()
>>> my_iHR320.set_mirror_position(my_iHR320.MIRROR_EXIT, my_iHR320.MIRROR_SIDE)
get_turret_position() → int

Get the turret position index. It could be [0 1 2] because

Returns

Index position of the turret.

Examples

To get the turret position.

>>> import iHR320
>>> my_iHR320 = iHR320()
>>> turret_position = my_iHR320.get_turret_position()
set_turret_position(position: int) → None

Set the turret position to select a particular grating.

Parameters

position – index position of the turret.

Examples

To set the turret to the position 2 .

>>> import iHR320
>>> my_iHR320 = iHR320()
>>> my_iHR320.set_turret(2)

get_slit_width(port: int, position: int) → float

Get the width in millimeter of the selected slit.

Parameters

  • port – Slit port (“Entrance” or “Exit”). Use iHR320.SLIT_ENTRANCE or iHR320.SLIT_EXIT property.

  • position – Slit Position (“Front” or “Side”). Use iHR320.SLIT_FRONT or iHR320.SLIT_SIDE property.

Returns

Width in millimeter of the selected slit.

Examples

To get the “Front” “Entrance” slit width.

>>> import iHR320
>>> my_iHR320 = iHR320()
>>> width = my_iHR320.get_slit_width(my_iHR320.SLIT_ENTRANCE, my_iHR320.SLIT_FRONT)
set_slit_width(port: int, position: int, width: float) → None

Set the width in millimeter of the selected slit.

Parameters

  • port –

    Slit port (“Entrance” or “Exit”).

    Use iHR320.SLIT_ENTRANCE or iHR320.SLIT_EXIT property.

  • position –

    Slit position (“Front” or “Side”).

    Use iHR320.SLIT_FRONT or iHR320.SLIT_SIDE property.

  • width – Width of the selected slit in millimeter.

Examples: To set the “Front” “Entrance” slit to 1.5 mm.

>>> import iHR320
>>> my_iHR320 = iHR320()
>>> my_iHR320.set_slit_width(my_iHR320.SLIT_ENTRANCE, my_iHR320.SLIT_FRONT, 1.5)

Get the position of the selected mirror.

Which port of the mirror (“Entrance” or “Exit”).

Use iHR320.MIRROR_ENTRANCE or iHR320.MIRROR_EXIT property.

The orientation of the selected mirror.

iHR320.MIRROR_FRONT or iHR320.MIRROR_SIDE orientation.

>>> mirror_position = my_iHR320.get_mirror_position(my_iHR320.MIRROR_ENTRANCE)
set_mirror_position(port: int, position: int) → None

Set the mirror position.

This function set the orientation of the selected mirror.

Parameters

  • port (int) –

    Which port of the mirror (“Entrance” or “Exit”).

    Use iHR320.MIRROR_ENTRANCE or iHR320.MIRROR_EXIT property.

  • position (int) – The orientation of the selected mirror iHR320.MIRROR_FRONT for the “Front” orientation or iHR320.MIRROR_SIDE for the “Side” orientation.

Examples: To set the “Exit” mirror to “Side” position.

>>> import iHR320
>>> my_iHR320 = iHR320()
>>> my_iHR320.set_mirror_position(my_iHR320.MIRROR_EXIT, my_iHR320.MIRROR_SIDE)
